subject: Travel
title: The Pyramid's Stolen Casing
description: Learn The Pyramid's Stolen Casing in one minute.

hook.text: The Great Pyramid once gleamed white. Its surface was covered in polished limestone.

buildup.text: The casing stones reflected sunlight so brightly the pyramid could be seen from mountains miles away.

discovery.text: An earthquake in 1303 AD loosened many of the outer stones and sent them tumbling.

twist.text: Cairo's rulers then stripped the rest to build mosques and fortresses across the city.

climax.text: A few casing stones remain at the base. They still show the original mirror-smooth polish.

punchline.text: The pyramid's skin became Cairo's buildings.

quiz.question: What happened to the Great Pyramid's polished limestone casing?
options: It was stripped to build Cairo's structures
